big_picture_notes: 1 Peter exhorts scattered ‘exiles’ to endure suffering by fixing hope on an incorruptible inheritance secured through Christ’s suffering and glory. The letter follows indicative→imperative→eschatology: living hope (1:1–12) → holiness and communal identity (1:13–2:10) → submission in the public sphere (2:11–3:12) → suffering, judgment, and the end’s nearness (3:13–4:19) → final charges and benediction (5:1–14). Inclusios (suffering 1:6; 5:10), exile/priesthood metaphors, and heavy OT citation knit theology to ethics.

stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (1:1) superscription opens; end (1:12) completes the salvation‑history vista angels long to behold. Glue: inheritance/salvation/faith/rejoicing lexemes and a past→present→future movement anchoring hope in the resurrection.

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Author/audience naming; grace/peace multiplied. Devices: dispersion/exile framing, triadic election language.
Blessed be God; new birth to living hope; guarded for salvation. Devices: doxological sentence, imperishable inheritance motif.
Grief in trials yet rejoicing; tested faith → praise/honor/glory; unseen Christ loved. Devices: refining‑fire metaphor, paradox of joy in suffering.
Prophets sought this grace; Spirit revealed; angels long to look. Devices: salvation‑history continuity, laudatory elevation of the message.

stories.story_title: The Call to Holiness and Purity
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (1:13) ‘Therefore’ launches imperatives; end (2:10) Hosea‑framed identity caps the holiness→love→word→people sequence. Glue: holiness/purity and word/new‑birth motifs; costly redemption motivates conduct.

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Gird minds, be sober, set hope; ‘Be holy for I am holy’. Devices: hortatory particle, Torah quotation, contrast with former desires.
Call on the Father; ransomed not with silver/gold but Christ’s blood; faith/hope in God. Devices: corruptible vs incorruptible antithesis, reverent fear.

scenes.scene_name: Love with a Pure Heart by the Word
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Having purified—love one another fervently; all flesh is grass; the word endures. Devices: Isa 40 citation, new‑birth by living word, inclusio close.
Lay aside vices; crave pure milk; ‘tasted the Lord is good’. Devices: infant growth metaphor, Psalm taste language.

scenes.scene_name: The Living Stone and Spiritual Priesthood
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Coming to the Living Stone; built a spiritual house; royal priesthood, holy nation—once not a people, now God’s people. Devices: cornerstone/stumbling citations, identity chain from Exodus/Isaiah/Hosea.

stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (2:11) pilgrim address pivots to public conduct; end (3:12) Psalm 34 citation seals the communal ethic before persecution focus. Glue: repeated ‘submit’ and the central Christ‑suffering example justifying unjust‑suffering submission.

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Abstain as sojourners; keep honorable conduct so Gentiles glorify God. Devices: exile metaphor, missional purpose clause.
Submit to every human institution; fear God, honor the king. Devices: civic apologetic, four‑part motto close.
Be subject even to the unjust; gracious when mindful of God. Devices: unjust‑suffering commendation, transitional setup to Christ model.

scenes.scene_name: Christ’s Suffering as the Ultimate Model
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: To this you were called—Christ suffered, leaving an example; Shepherd and Overseer. Devices: Isa 53 allusions, parallelism of non‑retaliation, pastoral metaphor.
Be subject; win without a word; inner imperishable beauty; Sarah example. Devices: evangelistic conduct, adornment contrast, OT exemplar.
Live considerately, honor the weaker vessel, co‑heirs of grace; prayers unhindered. Devices: concise charge with consequence.
Be of one mind, tenderhearted; not repaying evil; Psalm 34 quotation. Devices: exhortation chain, OT warrant and promise.

stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (3:13) rhetorical question opens suffering discourse; end (4:19) commit souls to the faithful Creator. Glue: páschō repetition, Christ’s passion pattern, end‑nearness and fiery‑trial markers.

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Who will harm you? Sanctify Christ; keep a good conscience; better to suffer for good. Devices: apologia instruction, proverbial wisdom.

scenes.scene_name: Christ’s Work in the Spirit (Descent and Triumph)
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Christ suffered once, made alive; Noah/baptism analogy; ascension with powers subject. Devices: typology, dense soteriological argument, triumph close.
Since Christ suffered, arm yourselves; break with Gentile past; gospel preached even to the dead. Devices: vice catalog, paradoxical judgment/life statement.

scenes.scene_name: Imminence of the End and Love
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: The end is near; be self‑controlled, love fervently, be hospitable, steward gifts; doxology. Devices: urgent paranesis, service lexicon, doxological aim.
Do not be surprised at fiery trial; rejoice; if as a Christian, do not be ashamed but glorify God. Devices: trial fire metaphor, name ‘Christian’, shame→glory reversal.
Judgment begins at God’s house; the righteous scarcely saved—what of the ungodly? Commit souls while doing good. Devices: proverb citation (LXX), trust exhortation.

stories.story_title: Exhortation to Leaders and Final Farewell
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (5:1) explicit address to elders opens peroratio; end (5:14) peace/amen benediction closes the letter. Glue: humility/resistance chain and closing prayer/greetings.

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Shepherd willingly, eagerly, as examples; receive unfading crown. Devices: triple contrasts, crown‑of‑glory promise.
All clothe in humility; cast cares; be sober; resist the roaring‑lion devil; brethren worldwide suffer. Devices: imperative chain, personification of the adversary.
After a little while, God perfects/establishes/strengthens/settles; doxology. Devices: four‑verb comfort, compact benediction.
By Silvanus…; greeting from ‘she in Babylon’; kiss of love; peace to all. Devices: letter‑carrier note, cryptic location, formulaic farewell.
